panels.visual: The purple rift descends upon Eysýsla like divine judgment. Where it touches earth, stone melts like wax. Wood bursts into unnatural flame that burns purple and cold. The fortress walls sag and flow like honey. People flee in all directions, screaming, burning with cold purple fire. Geometries that hurt to perceive fold through impossible tessellations. The entire island seems to collapse inward.
panels.dialogue: LeifSkull: "The compact is broken. Eysýsla will burn. Everything will burn."

panels.visual: Eskil rows desperately away from the island, the iron skull clutched against his chest. Behind him, Eysýsla folds in on itself, drawn up into the terrible wound in the sky. The purple rift swallows everything - fortress, village, bog, forest. Where the island stood, only blackened stone will remain. His massive form hunches over the oars, rowing south through the night.
panels.narration: Eskil rowed south through the night, following the coast. The compact was broken. The Goat had taken her due.
